body_html:
Will do. Thanks for identifying the issue.
…
On Mon, Oct 2, 2017 at 18:35 Soumith Chintala ***@***.***> wrote: Intermittent test failures occurring on AdaptiveMaxPool3d. @gchanan <https://github.com/gchanan> and I have seen this in the past where Max pooling has exactly the same values in the same window, then it's differently resolved on CPU/GPU. For example [0 2.5 2.5 3] can give a max index of 1 or 2 on CUDA depending on the runtime. So generating input values that are within epsilon of each other is important (especially at half precision). @SsnL <https://github.com/ssnl> fix that one. — You are receiving this because you were mentioned. Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub <#2939>, or mute the thread <https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/AFaWZQmApeXhffIHrmpbIih8nW5b62Loks5soWU1gaJpZM4PrWKH> .
body_text:
Will do. Thanks for identifying the issue.
…
On Mon, Oct 2, 2017 at 18:35 Soumith Chintala ***@***.***> wrote:
 Intermittent test failures occurring on AdaptiveMaxPool3d.

 @gchanan <https://github.com/gchanan> and I have seen this in the past
 where Max pooling has exactly the same values in the same window, then it's
 differently resolved on CPU/GPU. For example [0 2.5 2.5 3] can give a max
 index of 1 or 2 on CUDA depending on the runtime.

 So generating input values that are within epsilon of each other is
 important (especially at half precision).

 @SsnL <https://github.com/ssnl> fix that one.

 —
 You are receiving this because you were mentioned.
 Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub
 <#2939>, or mute the thread
 <https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/AFaWZQmApeXhffIHrmpbIih8nW5b62Loks5soWU1gaJpZM4PrWKH>
 .
body:
Will do. Thanks for identifying the issue.

> differently resolved on CPU/GPU. For example [0 2.5 2.5 3] can give a max
> index of 1 or 2 on CUDA depending on the runtime.
>
> So generating input values that are within epsilon of each other is
> important (especially at half precision).
>
